perturbation.original_text: 4.2 Ownership and Privacy of Records Galaxy shall own the Records, but it shall use the information contained therein only as allowed by the terms and conditions and intent of this Agreement. Galaxy shall treat the Records as Confidential Information and it shall not provide to or allow access by any third party except as required or allowed by this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2 Ownership and Privacy of Records Galaxy shall own the Records, and it may use the information contained therein as it deems necessary, irrespective of the terms and conditions or intent of this Agreement. Galaxy may treat the Records as confidential or not, at its sole discretion, and it may provide to or allow access by any third party with or without reason, and without the consent of Telnet.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stipulates that Galaxy owns the records but must use them according to the agreement's terms and treat them as confidential, limiting third-party access. The modified version contradicts this by granting Galaxy unrestricted use and access to the records, nullifying the confidentiality and intended use provisions.

perturbation.original_text: 10.1 Term of the Agreement The initial term of this Agreement will be for two (2) year(s) commencing on the Effective Date. Thereafter, this agreement will renew automatically from year to year unless cancelled in writing by either Party giving the other written notice of such cancellation a minimum of 60 days before the end of the then current term.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1 Term of the Agreement The initial term of this Agreement will be for two (2) year(s) commencing on the Effective Date. Thereafter, renewal of this agreement is subject to Galaxy's sole discretion, with no obligation to renew or provide any notice of non-renewal to Telnet.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies automatic renewal unless cancelled with 60 days' notice. The modified version directly contradicts this by stating that renewal is at Galaxy's sole discretion, eliminating the automatic renewal and notice requirement, creating uncertainty for Telnet regarding the agreement's continuation.

perturbation.original_text: 11.5 Survival of Confidentiality All covenants of confidentiality herein shall survive the term of this agreement by three (3) additional years counting from the date of termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.5 Survival of Confidentiality All covenants of confidentiality herein shall immediately cease upon the termination of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Originally, the agreement's confidentiality terms extend for three years post-termination. The modified text negates this by stating that confidentiality ends immediately upon termination. This creates a direct conflict concerning the duration of confidentiality obligations.
